We have PASSED the bill.

We can beat this virus, but how fast we do honestly depends on all of us being the team players we know we are. It is the only way we will mitigate this risk‚Ä¶together. 5/5
Practice social distancing; avoid being within six feet of people; avoid shaking hands; wash your hands often. Stay home unless you must leave for something mission critical. /4

Though most of us will likely not be severely impacted by this virus, it is our mothers, grandfathers, teachers, health care workers, and immuno-compromised friends and family that this virus threatens most. We must take this seriously and take care of one another. /3
We are renowned for our sense of community and our values -- how we, at our core, are just good neighbors. This crisis will test that spirit. /2
Since joining @GovernorTomWolf to declare a state of emergency in our community, I have been struck by the way our we have come together to address this challenge. /1

I will be joining @GovernorTomWolf to provide an update on the coronavirus and what action we‚Äôve taken at the federal level as well as speak to what we‚Äôre doing in our community to mitigate the spread. Tune in below. ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/Ctxcnj7zVt

Please know my office is a resource, and we are ready to help in any way we can. I was proud to support this crucial legislation and urge the Senate to send it to the President‚Äôs desk for signature. Minutes and hours matter. 5/5
We must work together to flatten the curve and mitigate the spread of this virus. I will continue to update our community with the latest developments. /4

This is not a time for partisan politics or misinformation. I worked across party lines and with the Administration to protect our community. I am committed to providing everyone with the facts, and I urge my colleagues to do the same. /3

I am proud to serve as the Freshman Leadership Representative for the New Democratic Coalition. We, like my community, are a pragmatic people leading on deliberate solutions to strengthen our economy, protect our planet, improve our health care, and defend our national security. https://t.co/KO8ktWla0g

Our community is home to so much innovation, and our local economy is growing thanks to smart people with great ideas. As a former entrepreneur, I know how hard it can be to scale an organization without help ‚Äì my team can work with you to compete for these resources! https://t.co/mh4Hsy94ar
Our READ Act makes clear that we‚Äôre fighting to make sure every child learns how to read, and consequently, can find success in their education and livelihoods. 5/5
We need aggressive action to combat the literacy crisis in our country, and as someone with a background in early childhood literacy, I‚Äôm proud to lead the charge. /4
Over $200 million in health care costs is linked to illiteracy each year: when individuals can‚Äôt understand their prescription bottle, how can we expect them to stay healthy? /3

It‚Äôs particularly hard and arguably impossible to grasp if you are reading at a 3rd or 4th grade level as many of my students were. Illiteracy is a problem in our education, our economy, and even our health care system. /2

On this #ReadAcrossAmericaDay, I am introducing my bipartisan READ Act with @RepWesterman. I absolutely loved being a chemistry teacher in north Philadelphia to amazingly engaging eleventh grade students. A lot of people think chemistry is a hard subject. /1

First up is Kathy Silvia, PA State Ambassador to the Military Services for America. She was one of the first female West Point graduates and served as an officer and engineer in the Army. From veteran to veteran, I am thankful for her service and her inspiring leadership. https://t.co/zHWGC6ZC0A
